author: doogie
msg: Remove synchronized here too; again, since we are adding/removing from a
cache, if 2 threads happen to not find anything, then it will just cause
a little bit of duplicated work.  It's better to that, then have a block
occur.  Class loading causes static constructors to run, which might end
up calling into the thread context class loader, which then might end up
starting other threads, which then could end up calling back into this
code path; instant dead-lock.  So, removing a lock stops the dead-lock

author: doogie
msg: Remove synchronized blocks when fetching/creating instances into the
local caches.  It's not important to make certain there is only one

author: doogie
msg: There is really no need to protect hint with a synchronized block.

author: doogie
msg: Annotation used to document how some other variable or method is
protected under some other locking mechanism.

author: doogie
msg: Remove javacc from the runtime library path.
